name: Snapshot Disk

steps.script:

steps.script:

if no_of_snapshots != 1:
    raise Exception("Expected 1 disk snapshot. Found : "+str(no_of_snapshots))
    
frappe.db.set_value("Server Snapshot", arguments.get("server_snapshot"), field_name, machine.flags.created_snapshots[0], update_modified=False)

machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", doc.virtual_machine)
machine.stop()

machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", doc.virtual_machine)
machine.sync()
result = (machine.status == "Stopped", False)
steps.step_name: Wait for Virtual Machine to Stop

name: Archive Server

steps.script:
machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", doc.virtual_machine)
machine.disable_termination_protection()

machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", doc.virtual_machine)
machine.terminate()

machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", doc.virtual_machine)
try:
    # Usually machine sync never fails
    # It can fail weirdly due to TimestampMismatchError or lock timeout
    # Don't fail this whole thing just because of that
    # Ignore the errors of sync and keep retrying
    machine.sync()
except:
    pass
result = (machine.status == "Terminated", False)
steps.step_name: Wait for Virtual Machine to Terminate

name: Create Server

steps.script:
machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", doc.virtual_machine)
machine.provision()

machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", doc.virtual_machine)
try:
    # Usually machine sync never fails
    # It can fail weirdly due to TimestampMismatchError or lock timeout
    # Don't fail this whole thing just because of that
    # Ignore the errors of sync and keep retrying
    machine.sync()

except (frappe.QueryDeadlockError, frappe.QueryTimeoutError, frappe.TimestampMismatchError):
    result = (False, False)
else:
    result = (machine.status == "Running", False)

server = frappe.get_doc(doc.server_type, doc.server)
server.ping_ansible()

plays = frappe.get_all("Ansible Play", {"server": doc.server, "play": "Ping Server"}, ["status"], order_by="creation desc", limit=1)

virtual_machine = frappe.get_doc("Virtual Machine", server.virtual_machine)

result = (plays and plays[0].status == "Success" and virtual_machine.private_ip_address != '', False)
steps.step_name: Wait for Server to be accessible

steps.script:
server = frappe.get_doc(doc.server_type, doc.server)
if server.provider == "AWS EC2" and frappe.db.get_value("Virtual Machine", server.virtual_machine, "data_disk_snapshot"):
    cleanup_db_replication_files = False
    if doc.server_type == "Database Server" and (server.is_for_recovery or arguments.get("setup_db_replication", False)):
        cleanup_db_replication_files = True
    server.mount_volumes(
        now=False,
        stop_docker_before_mount=doc.server_type == "Server",
        stop_mariadb_before_mount=doc.server_type == "Database Server",
        # If server is in recovery mode, don't start docker and containers
        # Because If site gets active, background job witll be started and that can modify data
        start_docker_after_mount=doc.server_type == "Server" and not server.is_for_recovery,
        # If goal is to create replica server, don't start database
        # As we need to do some additional config before starting database
        start_mariadb_after_mount=doc.server_type == "Database Server" and not arguments.get("setup_db_replication", False),
        cleanup_db_replication_files=cleanup_db_replication_files,
        # It's important to change uuid, labels of attached disk
        # There is high chance that the root disk and data disk might have same disk info
        rotate_additional_volume_metadata=True
    )
else:
    result = (False, False)

steps.step_name: Wait for Data Disk Mount to Complete
